sense.def:
One person or thing joins another
rečemo, kadar dve osebi ali predmeta prideta skupaj.

seg.quote: He went for a walk before joining his brother for tea.
The helicopter was quickly joined by a second.

sense.def:
To join a queue
pomeni, da gremo stat na konec vrste čakajočih.

seg.quote: They went off to join the queue for coffee.
The van joined the row of cars.

sense.def:
Kadar dve cesti ali reki
join
, ali kadar ena
joins the other
, se srečata ali prideta skupaj na določeni točki.

seg.quote: This road joins the motorway at junction 16.

sense.def:
To join an organization
pomeni postati član neke organizacije.

seg.quote: We both joined the Labour Party.

sense.def:
To join an activity
pomeni, da se začnemo ukvarjati z neko dejavnostjo.

seg.quote: They were invited to join the feasting.

sense.def:
To join two things
pomeni spojiti ali pritrditi dve stvari skupaj.

seg.quote: Draw a straight line joining these two points.
The cities are joined by telecommunication links.
Cut them down the middle and join the two outside edges together.

sense.def:
A join
je kraj, kjer sta dve stvari pritrjeni ali pripeti skupaj.

seg.quote: The repair was done so well, you could hardly see the join.

sense.def:
To join in an activity
pomeni, da se začnemo ukvarjati z neko dejavnostjo.

seg.quote: Parents should join in these discussions.

sense.def:
To join up
pomeni postati član oboroženih sil;

seg.quote: At eighteen, just before joining up and going abroad, I met Elizabeth.

sense.def:
To join up two things
pomeni pripeti ali pritrditi dve stvari skupaj.

seg.quote: I used to join up all his paper clips in a long chain.
